definition: son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)

pinyin: du2 sheng1 zi3 nu:3 zheng4 ce4

sentences.english: More often than not, divorcees in this age group will likely have a young child at home.
sentences.chinese: 通常，這個年齡段離婚的人已生有子女。

sentences.english: This film records a story about the parents' blind date for their children.
sentences.chinese: 相親會記錄了老人們爲子女相親的故事。

sentences.english: Villagers built Ruiyuan themselves to improve their children's opportunities.
sentences.chinese: 村民們修建了瑞元小學，以期改善子女的教育境況。

sentences.english: If they firmly believe one-child policy, there will be more and more the dink.
sentences.chinese: 如果他們堅信獨生子女政策，將會有越來越多的丁克。
中國實行獨生子女政策。

sentences.english: There is little doubt that maternal-child interaction plays a very important role in child development.
sentences.chinese: 親子互動關係對子女成長的重要性，已不容置疑。

sentences.english: Brown's offer to pay your client a thousand dollars a month for child support.
sentences.chinese: 布朗願意每個月付一千美元的子女扶養費。

sentences.english: Objective To investigate mental health status of only-child nurses.
sentences.chinese: 目的瞭解獨生子女護士的心理健康狀況。

sentences.english: If how want house property transfer ownership to deal with to filial body directly?
sentences.chinese: 假如直接把房產過戶到子女身上要如何辦理？

sentences.english: Strong relationships with her children helped Melissa maintain her social ranking.
sentences.chinese: 與子女牢固的關係幫助梅麗莎維持她的高級社會地位。

sentences.english: Illness of children or your personal health may need some medical attention.
sentences.chinese: 子女或你自己的健康狀況不佳，不要諱疾忌醫。

sentences.english: Some complained that their children were allocated places in areas such as Tseung Kwan O.
sentences.chinese: 有些家長投訴子女被派到將軍澳等地區。

sentences.english: The people who benefited the most were singles and empty-nesters.
sentences.chinese: 受惠最多的是未婚者和子女不在身邊的人。

definition: to support/to provide support for/to maintain
filial/dutiful/devoted to one's parents (and grandparents etc)/to show filial piety towards (an older family member)/filial piety
